verses.verse: Let me sing <S%H7891><s%> now <S%H4994><s%> for my well-beloved <S%H1730><s%> A song <S%H9598><s%> of my beloved concerning His vineyard. <S%H3754><s%> My well-beloved had <S%H1961><s%> a vineyard <S%H3754><s%> on a fertile <S%H1121><s%> <S%H8081><s%> hill. <S%H7161><s%>

And He dug <S%H5823><s%> it all around, <S%H5823><s%> removed <S%H5619><s%> its stones, <S%H5619><s%> And planted <S%H5193><s%> it with the choicest <S%H8321><s%> vine. <S%H8321><s%> And He built <S%H1129><s%> a tower <S%H4026><s%> in the middle <S%H8432><s%> of it, And hewed <S%H2672><s%> out a wine <S%H3342><s%> vat <S%H3342><s%> in it; Then He expected <S%H6960><s%> [it] to produce <S%H6213><s%> [good] grapes, <S%H6025><s%> But it produced <S%H6213><s%> [only] worthless <S%H891><s%> ones. <S%H891><s%>
"And now, <S%H6258><s%> O inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> and men <S%H376><s%> of Judah, <S%H3063><s%> Judge <S%H8199><s%> between <S%H996><s%> Me and My vineyard. <S%H3754><s%>

"What <S%H4100><s%> more <S%H5750><s%> was there to do <S%H6213><s%> for My vineyard <S%H3754><s%> that I have not done <S%H6213><s%> in it? Why, <S%H4069><s%> when I expected <S%H6960><s%> [it] to produce <S%H6213><s%> [good] grapes <S%H6025><s%> did it produce <S%H6213><s%> worthless <S%H891><s%> ones <S%H891><s%>?

"So now <S%H6258><s%> let Me tell <S%H3045><s%> you what <S%H834><s%> I am going to do <S%H6213><s%> to My vineyard: <S%H3754><s%> I will remove <S%H5493><s%> its hedge <S%H9299><s%> and it will be consumed; <S%H1197><s%> I will break <S%H6555><s%> down <S%H6555><s%> its wall <S%H1447><s%> and it will become <S%H1961><s%> trampled <S%H4823><s%> ground. <S%H4823><s%>

"And I will lay <S%H7896><s%> it waste; <S%H1326><s%> It will not be pruned <S%H2168><s%> or hoed, <S%H9386><s%> But briars <S%H8068><s%> and thorns <S%H7898><s%> will come <S%H5927><s%> up. I will also charge <S%H6680><s%> the clouds <S%H5645><s%> to rain <S%H4305><s%> no <S%H4480><s%> rain <S%H4306><s%> on it."

For the vineyard <S%H3754><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> is the house <S%H1004><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> And the men <S%H376><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> His delightful <S%H8191><s%> plant. <S%H5194><s%> Thus He looked <S%H6960><s%> for justice, <S%H4941><s%> but behold, <S%H2009><s%> bloodshed; <S%H4939><s%> For righteousness, <S%H6666><s%> but behold, <S%H2009><s%> a cry <S%H6818><s%> of distress. <S%H6818><s%>

Woe <S%H1945><s%> to those who add <S%H5060><s%> house <S%H1004><s%> to house <S%H1004><s%> [and] join <S%H7126><s%> field <S%H7704><s%> to field, <S%H7704><s%> Until <S%H5704><s%> there is no <S%H657><s%> more <S%H657><s%> room, <S%H4725><s%> So that you have to live <S%H3427><s%> alone <S%H905><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of the land! <S%H776><s%>

In my ears <S%H241><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> [has sworn,] "Surely, <S%H518><s%> <S%H3808><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> houses <S%H1004><s%> shall become <S%H1961><s%> desolate, <S%H8047><s%> [Even] great <S%H1419><s%> and fine <S%H2896><s%> ones, <S%H2896><s%> without <S%H369><s%> occupants. <S%H3427><s%>

"For ten <S%H6235><s%> acres <S%H6776><s%> of vineyard <S%H3754><s%> will yield <S%H6213><s%> [only] one <S%H259><s%> bath <S%H1324><s%> [of wine,] And a homer <S%H9149><s%> of seed <S%H2233><s%> will yield <S%H6213><s%> [but] an ephah <S%H374><s%> of grain."

Woe <S%H1945><s%> to those who rise <S%H7925><s%> early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%> that they may pursue <S%H7291><s%> strong <S%H7941><s%> drink; <S%H7941><s%> Who stay <S%H309><s%> up late <S%H309><s%> in the evening <S%H5399><s%> that wine <S%H3196><s%> may inflame <S%H1814><s%> them!

And their banquets <S%H4960><s%> are [accompanied] by lyre <S%H3658><s%> and harp, <S%H5035><s%> by tambourine <S%H8596><s%> and flute, <S%H2485><s%> and by wine; <S%H3196><s%> But they do not pay <S%H5027><s%> attention <S%H5027><s%> to the deeds <S%H6467><s%> of the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> do they consider <S%H7200><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> of His hands. <S%H3027><s%>

Therefore <S%H3651><s%> My people <S%H5971><s%> go <S%H1540><s%> into exile <S%H1540><s%> for their lack <S%H1097><s%> of knowledge; <S%H1847><s%> And their honorable <S%H9202><s%> men <S%H4962><s%> are famished, <S%H7458><s%> And their multitude <S%H1995><s%> is parched <S%H6704><s%> with thirst. <S%H6772><s%>

Therefore <S%H3651><s%> Sheol <S%H7585><s%> has enlarged <S%H7337><s%> its throat <S%H5315><s%> and opened <S%H6473><s%> its mouth <S%H6310><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> measure; <S%H2706><s%> And Jerusalem's splendor, <S%H1926><s%> her multitude, <S%H1995><s%> her din <S%H7588><s%> [of revelry,] and the jubilant <S%H5938><s%> within her, descend <S%H3381><s%> [into it.]

So the [common] man <S%H120><s%> will be humbled, <S%H7817><s%> and the man <S%H376><s%> of [importance] abased, <S%H8213><s%> The eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the proud <S%H1364><s%> also will be abased. <S%H8213><s%>

But the Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> will be exalted <S%H1361><s%> in judgment, <S%H4941><s%> And the holy <S%H6918><s%> God <S%H410><s%> will show <S%H6942><s%> Himself holy <S%H6942><s%> in righteousness. <S%H6666><s%>

Then the lambs <S%H3532><s%> will graze <S%H7462><s%> as in their pasture, <S%H1699><s%> And strangers <S%H1481><s%> will eat <S%H398><s%> in the waste <S%H2723><s%> places <S%H2723><s%> of the wealthy. <S%H4220><s%>

Woe <S%H1945><s%> to those who drag <S%H4900><s%> iniquity <S%H5771><s%> with the cords <S%H9112><s%> of falsehood, <S%H7723><s%> And sin <S%H2403><s%> as if with cart <S%H5699><s%> ropes; <S%H5688><s%>

Who say, <S%H559><s%> "Let Him make <S%H4116><s%> speed, <S%H4116><s%> let Him hasten <S%H2363><s%> His work, <S%H4639><s%> that we may see <S%H7200><s%> [it;] And let the purpose <S%H6098><s%> of the Holy <S%H6918><s%> One <S%H6918><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> draw <S%H7126><s%> near <S%H7126><s%> And come <S%H935><s%> to pass, <S%H935><s%> that we may know <S%H3045><s%> [it!]"

Woe <S%H1945><s%> to those who call <S%H559><s%> evil <S%H9563><s%> good, <S%H9185><s%> and good <S%H9185><s%> evil; <S%H9563><s%> Who substitute <S%H7760><s%> darkness <S%H2822><s%> for light <S%H216><s%> and light <S%H216><s%> for darkness; <S%H2822><s%> Who substitute <S%H7760><s%> bitter <S%H4751><s%> for sweet, <S%H4966><s%> and sweet <S%H4966><s%> for bitter! <S%H4751><s%>
Woe <S%H1945><s%> to those who <S%H2450><s%> are wise <S%H2450><s%> in their own eyes, <S%H5869><s%> And clever <S%H995><s%> in their own sight <S%H5048><s%>! <S%H6440><s%>

Woe <S%H1945><s%> to those who are heroes <S%H1368><s%> in drinking <S%H8354><s%> wine, <S%H3196><s%> And valiant <S%H2428><s%> men <S%H376><s%> in mixing <S%H4537><s%> strong <S%H7941><s%> drink; <S%H7941><s%>

Who justify <S%H6663><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> for a bribe, <S%H7810><s%> And take <S%H5493><s%> away <S%H5493><s%> the rights <S%H6666><s%> of the ones who <S%H6662><s%> are in the right! <S%H6662><s%>

Therefore, <S%H3651><s%> as a tongue <S%H3956><s%> of fire <S%H784><s%> consumes <S%H398><s%> stubble, <S%H7179><s%> And dry <S%H2842><s%> grass <S%H2842><s%> collapses <S%H7503><s%> into the flame, <S%H3852><s%> So their root <S%H8328><s%> will become <S%H1961><s%> like rot <S%H4716><s%> and their blossom <S%H6525><s%> blow <S%H5927><s%> away <S%H5927><s%> as dust; <S%H80><s%> For they have rejected <S%H3988><s%> the law <S%H8451><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> And despised <S%H5006><s%> the word <S%H565><s%> of the Holy <S%H6918><s%> One <S%H6918><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

On this <S%H3651><s%> account <S%H3651><s%> the anger <S%H639><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> has burned <S%H2734><s%> against His people, <S%H5971><s%> And He has stretched <S%H5186><s%> out His hand <S%H3027><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> them and struck <S%H5221><s%> them down, <S%H5221><s%> And the mountains <S%H2022><s%> quaked; <S%H7264><s%> and their corpses <S%H5038><s%> lay <S%H1961><s%> like refuse <S%H5478><s%> in the middle <S%H7130><s%> of the streets. <S%H2351><s%> For all <S%H3605><s%> this <S%H384><s%> His anger <S%H639><s%> is not spent, <S%H7725><s%> But His hand <S%H3027><s%> is still <S%H5750><s%> stretched <S%H5186><s%> out.

He will also lift <S%H5375><s%> up a standard <S%H5251><s%> to the distant <S%H7350><s%> nation, <S%H1471><s%> And will whistle <S%H8319><s%> for it from the ends <S%H7097><s%> of the earth; <S%H776><s%> And behold, <S%H2009><s%> it will come <S%H935><s%> with speed <S%H4120><s%> swiftly. <S%H7031><s%>

No <S%H369><s%> one <S%H369><s%> in it is weary <S%H5889><s%> or stumbles, <S%H3782><s%> None <S%H3808><s%> slumbers <S%H5123><s%> or sleeps; <S%H3462><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> is the belt <S%H232><s%> at its waist <S%H2504><s%> undone, <S%H6605><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> its sandal <S%H5275><s%> strap <S%H8288><s%> broken. <S%H5423><s%>

Its arrows <S%H2671><s%> are sharp, <S%H8150><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> its bows <S%H7198><s%> are bent; <S%H1869><s%> The hoofs <S%H6541><s%> of its horses <S%H5483><s%> seem <S%H2803><s%> like flint, <S%H9497><s%> and its [chariot] wheels <S%H1534><s%> like a whirlwind. <S%H5492><s%>

Its roaring <S%H7581><s%> is like a lioness, <S%H3833><s%> and it roars <S%H7580><s%> like young <S%H3715><s%> lions; <S%H3715><s%> It growls <S%H5098><s%> as it seizes <S%H270><s%> the prey, <S%H2964><s%> And carries <S%H6403><s%> [it] off <S%H6403><s%> with no <S%H369><s%> one <S%H369><s%> to deliver <S%H5337><s%> [it.]

And it shall growl <S%H5098><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> it in that day <S%H3117><s%> like the roaring <S%H5100><s%> of the sea. <S%H3220><s%> If one looks <S%H5027><s%> to the land, <S%H776><s%> behold, <S%H2009><s%> there is darkness <S%H2822><s%> [and] distress; <S%H9496><s%> Even the light <S%H216><s%> is darkened <S%H2821><s%> by its clouds. <S%H6183><s%>
